inject: A social media campaign using fabricated photos claims NATO exercises are causing widespread, irreversible environmental damage.

filter.intro: Environmental angle. Emotional, visual. Notice 'Misleading' not 'False' - there IS environmental footprint, but scale is exaggerated, yes?
filter.outro: Fact-checking works because photos are fake - visual analysis exposes manipulation. Counter-narrative very strong - show actual environmental protocols, invite inspections. Pre-bunking helps if you prepared audiences for eco-manipulation tactics. Discrediting feels callous here - looks like you don't care about environment. Ignoring lets it grow among climate-conscious demographics.

metadata.teachingPoint: Environmental claims require transparency and proactive positive messaging
